Package gov.tak.api.cot.event

Class CotDetail

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.tak.api.cot.event.CotDetail
  • public class CotDetail
extends java.lang.Object
    Data extracted from or to be composed into a Cursor-on-Target detail element. This manages a set of attributes (name/value pairs encoded/decoded as XML element attributes, and a list of child CotDetail elements or a text value.
    Since:
    6.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • getElementName

        public java.lang.String getElementName()
        Returns:
        the element name

      • getInnerText

        public java.lang.String getInnerText()
        Get the inner text of the tag if any. This does not return XML representation of sub tags. Inner-text and sub-tags are mutually exclusive.
        Returns:
        the inner text of the tag

      • setInnerText

        public void setInnerText​(java.lang.String text)
        Set the inner text of this tag. Since sub tags and inner text are mutually exclusive, calling this removes any sub detail tags.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to use instead of child elements

      • hasAttribute

        public boolean hasAttribute​(java.lang.String name)
        Test if a given attribute has been set.
        Parameters:
        name - attribute name
        Returns:
        true if an attribute of that name has been set

      • getAttribute

        @NonNull
public java.lang.String getAttribute​(@NonNull
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     @NonNull
                                     java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Get an attribute value by name, returning the provided default if the attribute is null.
        Parameters:
        name - attribute name
        defaultValue - The default value to use if the attribute is null
        Returns:
        the attribute (or default value if null)

      • setAttribute

        public void setAttribute​(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String value)
        Set an attribute. There is no need to do any special escaping of the value. When an XML string is built, escaping of illegal characters is done automatically.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute name
        value - the value

      • removeAttribute

        public java.lang.String removeAttribute​(java.lang.String name)
        Remove an attribute.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute name (can be anything)
        Returns:
        get the value removed if any

        The number of sub tags in this detail tag

      • getChild

        public CotDetail getChild​(int index)
        Get a child detail tag at a given index or null if the index is invalid at the time of the call.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of child to retrieve
        Returns:
        the child at the provided index

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<CotDetail> getChildren()
        Get a list of this detail's children. This is much faster than calling getChild(int) in a loop.
        Returns:
        List of child nodes

      • getChildrenByName

        public java.util.List<CotDetail> getChildrenByName​(java.lang.String name)
        Get all children details with a matching element name
        Parameters:
        name - Element name
        Returns:
        List of child nodes

      • addChild

        public CotDetail addChild​(@NonNull
                          CotDetail detail)
        Add a sub detail tag. Since sub tags and inner text are mutually exclusive, this will clear any inner text.
        Parameters:
        detail - Detail child to add
        Returns:
        The child added

      • removeChild

        public void removeChild​(@NonNull
                        CotDetail detail)
        Remove a child.

      • getFirstChildByName

        public CotDetail getFirstChildByName​(java.lang.String childElementName)
        Get the first child element of a given name starting at index 0, returning null if no child with the given name is found, or the startIndex is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        childElementName - element name of interest
        Returns:
        the first child with the child element name, or null if not found

      • getFirstChildByName

        public CotDetail getFirstChildByName​(int startIndex,
                                     java.lang.String childElementName)
        Get the first child element of a given name starting at the given index, returning null if no child with the given name is found, or the startIndex is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - the start index
        childElementName - element name of interest
        Returns:
        the first child with the child element name, or null if not found
